intro: Octomeria grandiflora var. seegeriana, commonly known as the Seeger's octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
